titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the A.A. Desser papers, 1936-1937

address.addressline: Fifth Avenue at 42nd Street, New York, NY 10018-2788

did.abstract: A. A. Desser was a labor organizer for the International Ladies Garment Workers Union. This small collection of his papers includes a diary about his activities as an organizer in Springfield, Massachusetts and other Massachusetts towns and in Herkimer, New York during the years 1936-1937. The papers also include miscellaneous notes and transcripts of court testimony

prefercite.p: A.A. Desser papers, Manuscripts and Archives Division, The New York Public Library
